Articles.Content: How are you supposed to control the kerbal jetpack during weightless EVAs? According to the controls settings menu WASD and left shift/control should work, but those keys do nothing, even though my character is both flying and has 100% jetpack fuel.
You also need to press the 'r' key to put it on jet pack mode.

Thanks, that wasn\'t very obvious.

Also, how can you set to change the camera\'s position without having the kerbal follow it?
I can\'t make the kerbal change position if I try to! other than rotating around and pressing C for a random alignment that is. What are yall doing?

The kerbal will change his orientation to face away from the camera during weightless EVA when the jetpack is on whenever you\'re actively thrusting; I\'d like some way to thrust while the kerbal isn\'t facing the same direction the camera is and I\'m not sure if it exists.
Map the RCS pack thrust to the numpad. You will be able to use the pack without reorienting the Kerbal.

instead of RMB, I\'d like to see Q and E for rotation, with out the orientation snap for the camera, only the direction snap. But a tutorial, similar to the VAB and flight tutorials would be good for new players.

EDIT: that should have been LMB, not RMB

instead of RMB, I\'d like to see Q and E for rotation, with out the orientation snap for the camera, only the direction snap. But a tutorial, similar to the VAB and flight tutorials would be good for new players.

Yeah, I like this control method as well. The current controls restrict me to a static 'up' and 'down' which feel really weird when my ship is at some crazy angle. o_o
While on the jet pack, you can use left mouse to spin. Quickly turn off the jet pack to have your kerbal spinning forever.

I know this. The point is, the rotation re-orients itself as soon as you try and do anything useful. What I was suggesting was to have only direction auto orent, instead of rotation. This way, you could perform EVA \'upside down\' relative to the camera.
